Description: Fragment of handle-plate and rim of a North Ionian pottery krater; maeander band on rim; on handle-plate opposed spirals connected by triple lines, with added leaves; edges of plate glazed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 213, no. 30)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 107, pl. XXXIV, no. 318.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.533)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4739 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
